intro: Psychotria roseocrema, commonly known as the rose-colored psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria roseocrema is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids.
